00001                                 /* Sparse triangular numeric matrices */
00002 #include "dtCMatrix.h"
00003 #include "cs_utils.h"
00004 
00005 #define RETURN(_CH_)   UNPROTECT(1); return (_CH_);
00006 
00007 /* This is used for *BOTH* triangular and symmetric Csparse: */
00008 SEXP tCMatrix_validate(SEXP x)
00009 {
00010     SEXP val = xCMatrix_validate(x);/* checks x slot */
00011     if(isString(val))
00012         return(val);
00013     else {
00014         SEXP
00015             islot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym),
00016             pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym);
00017         int uploT = (*uplo_P(x) == 'U'),
00018             k, nnz = length(islot),
00019             *xi = INTEGER(islot),
00020             *xj = INTEGER(PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, nnz)));
00021 
00022         expand_cmprPt(length(pslot) - 1, INTEGER(pslot), xj);
00023 
00024         /* Maybe FIXME: ">" should be ">="      for diag = 'U' (uplo = 'U') */
00025         if(uploT) {
00026             for (k = 0; k < nnz; k++)
00027                 if(xi[k] > xj[k]) {
00028                     RETURN(mkString(_("uplo='U' must not have sparse entries below the diagonal")));
00029                 }
00030         }
00031         else {
00032             for (k = 0; k < nnz; k++)
00033                 if(xi[k] < xj[k]) {
00034                     RETURN(mkString(_("uplo='L' must not have sparse entries above the diagonal")));
00035                 }
00036         }
00037 
00038         RETURN(ScalarLogical(1));
00039     }
00040 }
00041 
00042 /* This is used for *BOTH* triangular and symmetric Rsparse: */
00043 SEXP tRMatrix_validate(SEXP x)
00044 {
00045     SEXP val = xRMatrix_validate(x);/* checks x slot */
00046     if(isString(val))
00047         return(val);
00048     else {
00049         SEXP
00050             jslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym),
00051             pslot = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym);
00052         int uploT = (*uplo_P(x) == 'U'),
00053             k, nnz = length(jslot),
00054             *xj = INTEGER(jslot),
00055             *xi = INTEGER(PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, nnz)));
00056 
00057         expand_cmprPt(length(pslot) - 1, INTEGER(pslot), xi);
00058 
00059         /* Maybe FIXME: ">" should be ">="      for diag = 'U' (uplo = 'U') */
00060         if(uploT) {
00061             for (k = 0; k < nnz; k++)
00062                 if(xi[k] > xj[k]) {
00063                     RETURN(mkString(_("uplo='U' must not have sparse entries below the diagonal")));
00064                 }
00065         }
00066         else {
00067             for (k = 0; k < nnz; k++)
00068                 if(xi[k] < xj[k]) {
00069                     RETURN(mkString(_("uplo='L' must not have sparse entries above the diagonal")));
00070                 }
00071         }
00072 
00073         RETURN(ScalarLogical(1));
00074     }
00075 }

00077 #undef RETURN

00079 SEXP dtCMatrix_matrix_solve(SEXP a, SEXP b, SEXP classed)
00080 {
00081     int cl = asLogical(classed);
00082     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("dgeMatrix")));
00083     CSP A = AS_CSP(a);
00084     int *adims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(a, Matrix_DimSym)),
00085         *bdims = INTEGER(cl ? GET_SLOT(b, Matrix_DimSym) :
00086                          getAttrib(b, R_DimSymbol));
00087     int j, n = bdims[0], nrhs = bdims[1], lo = (*uplo_P(a) == 'L');
00088     double *bx;
00089     R_CheckStack();
00090 
00091     if (*adims != n || nrhs < 1 || *adims < 1 || *adims != adims[1])
00092         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00093     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2)), bdims, 2);
00094     /* FIXME: copy dimnames or Dimnames as well */
00095     bx = Memcpy(REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, REALSXP, n * nrhs)),
00096                 REAL(cl ? GET_SLOT(b, Matrix_xSym):b), n * nrhs);
00097     for (j = 0; j < nrhs; j++)
00098         lo ? cs_lsolve(A, bx + n * j) : cs_usolve(A, bx + n * j);
00099     UNPROTECT(1);
00100     return ans;
00101 }
00102 
00103 SEXP dtCMatrix_sparse_solve(SEXP a, SEXP b)
00104 {
00105     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("dgCMatrix")));
00106     CSP A = AS_CSP(a), B = AS_CSP(b);
00107     int *xp = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym, INTSXP, (B->n) + 1)),
00108         xnz = 10 * B->p[B->n];  /* initial estimate of nnz in x */
00109     int *ti = Calloc(xnz, int), k, lo = uplo_P(a)[0] == 'L', pos = 0;
00110     double *tx = Calloc(xnz, double);
00111     double  *wrk = Alloca(A->n, double);
00112     int *xi = Alloca(2*A->n, int);      /* for cs_reach */
00113     R_CheckStack();
00114 
00115     if (A->m != A->n || B->n < 1 || A->n < 1 || A->n != B->m)
00116         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00117     slot_dup(ans, b, Matrix_DimSym);
00118     SET_DimNames(ans, b);
00119     xp[0] = 0;
00120     for (k = 0; k < B->n; k++) {
00121         int top = cs_spsolve (A, B, k, xi, wrk, (int *)NULL, lo);
00122         int nz = A->n - top, p;
00123 
00124         xp[k + 1] = nz + xp[k];
00125         if (xp[k + 1] > xnz) {
00126             while (xp[k + 1] > xnz) xnz *= 2;
00127             ti = Realloc(ti, xnz, int);
00128             tx = Realloc(tx, xnz, double);
00129         }
00130         if (lo)                 /* increasing row order */
00131             for(p = top; p < A->n; p++, pos++) {
00132                 ti[pos] = xi[p];
00133                 tx[pos] = wrk[xi[p]];
00134             }
00135         else                    /* decreasing order, reverse copy */
00136             for(p = A->n - 1; p >= top; p--, pos++) {
00137                 ti[pos] = xi[p];
00138                 tx[pos] = wrk[xi[p]];
00139             }
00140     }
00141     xnz = xp[B->n];
00142     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_iSym, INTSXP,  xnz)), ti, xnz);
00143     Memcpy(   REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, REALSXP, xnz)), tx, xnz);
00144 
00145     Free(ti); Free(tx);
00146     UNPROTECT(1);
00147     return ans;
00148 }
